ModuleDescription: In this course students will study and practice a range of writing genres including the personal essay, the academic essay, and the nuances of writing in their chosen disciplines. Students will read short essays, engage with current writing theory, and can expect to practice regular writing exercises. Students will also receive practical training in one-on-one peer tutoring and leading larger group workshops. By the end of the course, students will have a sound understanding of the dialects of writing and if they receive an A, become qualified to become peer tutors.
